Reason: The 'dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly impacts the behavior of the dynamic snitch in choosing replicas, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. The configuration involves performance-related operations that are time-expensive and memory-expensive, as it controls how much worse a pinned host has to be before other replicas are preferred. This can significantly affect system performance by influencing cache capacity and replica selection, making it a critical configuration for performance optimization.
